1.name: Dumbo
1.description: Ridiculed because of his enormous ears, a young circus elephant is assisted by a mouse to achieve his full potential.

2.name: Adventures of Captain Marvel
2.description: To protect a magic talisman from being used for evil, a teenage boy named Billy Batson is given the power to become an adult superhero, Captain Marvel, with a single magic word: "Shazam!"

3.name: Citizen Kane
3.description: Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to discover the meaning of his final utterance.

4.name: The Maltese Falcon
4.description: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.

5.name: The Gay Falcon
5.description: The Falcon investigates jewel thieves who are working with hard up socialites to defraud insurance companies. First of the Falcon series.

6.name: Penny Serenade
6.description: A couple's big dreams give way to a life full of unexpected sadness and unexpected joy.

7.name: Come Live with Me
7.description: Seeking US citizenship, a Viennese refugee arranges a marriage of convenience with a struggling writer.

8.name: Footsteps in the Dark
8.description: A respected investment advisor has a double life as a mystery writer and becomes involved in the real murder of a shady client.

9.name: How Green Was My Valley
9.description: At the turn of the century in a Welsh mining village, the Morgans, he stern, she gentle, raise coal-mining sons and hope their youngest will find a better life.

10.name: Two-Faced Woman
10.description: After a ski instructor catches her husband flirting with an old flame, she decides to pose as her (fictitious) twin sister in an attempt to keep him faithful.

11.name: Meet Boston Blackie
11.description: When a murder occurs on an ocean liner docked in New York, the trail leads to Coney Island and a spy ring.

12.name: The Wolf Man
12.description: A practical man returns to his homeland, is attacked by a creature of folklore, and infected with a horrific disease his disciplined mind tells him can not possibly exist.

13.name: Suspicion
13.description: A shy young heiress marries a charming gentleman, and soon begins to suspect he is planning to murder her.

14.name: Sergeant York
14.description: A marksman is drafted in World War I and ends up becoming one of the most celebrated war heroes.

15.name: High Sierra
15.description: After being released from prison, notorious thief Roy Earle is hired by his old boss to help a group of inexperienced criminals plan and carry out the robbery of a California resort.

16.name: Sullivan's Travels
16.description: A director of escapist films goes on the road as a hobo to learn about life, which gives him a rude awakening.

17.name: Men of Boys Town
17.description: Mickey Rooney and Spencer Tracy return in this sequel to the original Boys Town. This time the school faces financial trouble as Father Flannigan tries to help every little boy he meets. ...                See full summary »

18.name: Ball of Fire
18.description: A group of professors working on a new encyclopedia encounter a mouthy nightclub singer who is wanted by the police to help bring down her mob boss lover.

19.name: The Lady Eve
19.description: A trio of classy card sharks targets the socially awkward heir to brewery millions for his money, until one of them falls in love with him.

20.name: Ziegfeld Girl
20.description: Discovery by Flo Ziegfeld changes a girl's life but not necessarily for the better, as three beautiful women find out when they join the spectacle on Broadway: Susan, the singer who must ...                See full summary »

21.name: The Little Foxes
21.description: The ruthless, moneyed Hubbard clan lives in, and poisons, their part of the deep South at the turn of the twentieth century.

22.name: Tom, Dick and Harry
22.description: Working girl Janie is proposed to by a conservative car salesman, a bohemian auto mechanic, and a millionaire playboy and must make a choice.

23.name: 49th Parallel
23.description: A World War II U-boat crew are stranded in northern Canada. To avoid internment, they must make their way to the border and get into the still-neutral U.S.

24.name: You'll Never Get Rich
24.description: In order to cover up his philandering ways, a married Broadway producer sets one of his dancers up on a date with a chorus girl for whom he had bought a gift, but the two dancers fall in love for real.

25.name: Meet John Doe
25.description: A man needing money agrees to impersonate a nonexistent person who said he'd be committing suicide as a protest, and a political movement begins.

26.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
26.description: Dr. Jekyll allows his dark side to run wild when he drinks a potion that turns him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

27.name: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
27.description: A couple who have been married for three years are shocked to learn that their marriage is not legally valid.

28.name: They Died with Their Boots On
28.description: A highly fictionalized account of the life of George Armstrong Custer from his arrival at West Point in 1857 to his death at the battle of the Little Big Horn in 1876.

29.name: I Wake Up Screaming
29.description: Why is Inspector Ed Cornell trying to railroad Frankie Christopher for the murder of model Vicky Lynn?

30.name: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
30.description: Boxer Joe Pendleton dies 50 years too soon due to a heavenly mistake, and is given a new life as a millionaire playboy.

31.name: Blood and Sand
31.description: Illiterate peasant Juan Gallardo rises meteorically to fame and fortune in the bullfight arena only to sow the seeds of his own fall.

32.name: The Devil and Daniel Webster
32.description: A nineteenth-century New Hampshire farmer who makes a pact with Satan for economic success enlists Daniel Webster to extract him from his contract.

33.name: Sun Valley Serenade
33.description: When Phil Corey's band arrives at the Idaho ski resort its pianist Ted Scott is smitten with a Norwegian refugee he has sponsored, Karen Benson. When soloist Vivian Dawn quits, Karen stages an ice show as a substitute.

34.name: Hellzapoppin'
34.description: Olsen and Johnson, a pair of stage comedians, try to turn their play into a movie and bring together a young couple in love, while breaking the fourth wall every step of the way.

35.name: The Devil and Miss Jones
35.description: A tycoon goes undercover to ferret out agitators at a department store, but gets involved in their lives instead.

36.name: Hold Back the Dawn
36.description: Stopped in Mexico by U.S. Immigration, Georges Iscovescu hopes to get into the country by marrying a citizen.

37.name: Tarzan's Secret Treasure
37.description: Tarzan's jungle home, and his family, Jane and Boy, are threatened by men greedy for gold.

38.name: The Shanghai Gesture
38.description: In Shanghai, dragon-lady 'Mother' Gin Sling operates a gambling house for wealthy patrons but she clashes with influential land developer Sir Guy Charteris who wants to put her out-of-business.

39.name: Shadow of the Thin Man
39.description: Nick and Nora are at their wisecracking best as they investigate murder and racketeering at a local race track.

40.name: Ladies in Retirement
40.description: The housekeeper to a retired actress tries at the same time to look after her own two emotionally disturbed sisters, with dramatic results.

41.name: Topper Returns
41.description: A fun-loving young woman finds herself murdered after trading bedrooms with her wealthy friend. Her ghost seeks aid from a banker to find out why and by whom.

42.name: The Reluctant Dragon
42.description: Humorist Robert Benchley learns about the animation process at Walt Disney Studios while trying to find the great man himself to pitch him the idea of making a cartoon about a shy dragon.

43.name: I Wanted Wings
43.description: Story follows the training and personal lives of three recruits in the Army Air Corps --- a wealthy playboy, a college jock and an auto mechanic. Love interest is supplied by a female ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Great Lie
44.description: After a newlywed's husband apparently dies in a plane crash, she discovers that her rival for his affections is now pregnant with his child.

45.name: The 47 Ronin
45.description: In 1701, Lord Takuminokami Asano has a feud with Lord Kira and he tries to kill Kira in the corridors of the Shogun's palace. The Shogun sentences Lord Asano to commit suppuku and deprives ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Sea Wolf
46.description: After being fished out of the sea by a sealer, three fugitives find themselves prisoners of the ship's brutal skipper who refuses to put them ashore and they hatch an escape plan during a crew mutiny.

47.name: Man Hunt
47.description: British hunter Thorndike vacationing in Bavaria has Hitler in his gun sight. He is captured, beaten, left for dead, and escapes back to London where he is hounded by German agents and aided by a young woman.

48.name: Sundown
48.description: In 1941, a mysterious Somaliland native woman helps the British against the Nazis.

49.name: Hold That Ghost
49.description: After inheriting a fortune from a gangster, two dim-witted service station attendants find themselves stranded in a haunted house.

50.name: Honky Tonk
50.description: Fast-talking con-man and grifter Candy Johnson rises to be the corrupt boss of Yellow Creek, but his wife's alcoholic father tries to set things right.
